title.narrative: 503.2. ACCESS&STRENGTHEN QUALITY OF EDUC

description.narrative: 503.2. Access&strengthen quality of Educ nd improved Education Management Information System (EMIS) functionality at all levels, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The Basic Education Program will increase equitable access to quality basic education for children and young people in and out of school (including returnees, nomads, former child soldiers, children with special need s, and other vulnerable children). The main strategies are: a) institutional capacity building and system development to improve policy analysis, educational planning, management and delivery of basic education services. This will include policy development, curriculum review, establishing Education Management Information System (EMIS) and teacher training, Early Child Development (ECD) and implementing an essential package of interventions in all CFS targeted schools b) Service delivery will be done and will include construction of schools, supply of teaching and learning materials, school uniforms/ bags, recreational facilities and school feeding. c) Community mobilization and participation involving parents and local school communities will continue building school co-management structures for creation of more conducive child-friendly learning environments d) Children's participation will be supported through girls' and peace ambassadors' clubs to promote gender equity and peace building e) A cross-sectoral approach will be employed to contribute to improve quality of education and retention of girls, through collaboration with Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme for provision of water and sanitation facilities and promotion of personal hygiene and with HIV/AIDS programme for HIV/AIDS life skills for pupils and teachers f) Rights-based approach facilitates focus on mainstreaming gender responsiveness in education system and disparity reduction including interventions that benefit Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs), returnees and children in rural under-served areas (g) Coordination - UNICEF as the sector lead will continue to support efforts to expand and strength en broad-based participation in the education sector. 2012 PCR1: Education system, policies, human resources and institutions are developed, and human resource capacity improved at all levels, in order to ensure effective management and quality education services for all. 2012 PCR2: 2.7 million children (IDPs, returnees, girls, nomads, emergency affected, children with special needs) including one million children & young people out of school, have equitable access to and completion of quality formal basic education in child friendly learning environments by end 2012 in Sudan.
